articles.headline: ‘What if We All Get Sick?’: Coronavirus Strains China’s Health System
articles.snippet: To fight the expanding outbreak, the country is relying on a medical system that is overburdened even in normal times.
articles.abstract: To fight the expanding outbreak, the country is relying on a medical system that is overburdened even in normal times.
articles.lead_paragraph: After suffering from a fever and breathing problems for more than 15 days, Xiao Shibing, a 51-year-old resident of Wuhan, China, finally sought help at a hospital. Despite the symptoms, he was not tested for the new coronavirus — a lapse suggesting that there may be far more cases of the virus than are being officially reported.

articles.headline: At Auschwitz, Holocaust Survivors Plead ‘Never Forget’
articles.snippet: Organizers sought to put a spotlight on the stories of survivors, as this may be the last time that such a large number will be able to gather in one place.
articles.abstract: Organizers sought to put a spotlight on the stories of survivors, as this may be the last time that such a large number will be able to gather in one place.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSCHWITZ-BIRKENAU, Poland — They wore scarves emblazoned with their prisoner numbers, the same ones tattooed on their arms. Many were frail, walking only with the support of friends or relatives.

articles.headline: China’s Coronavirus Has Revived Global Economic Fears
articles.snippet: The spread of the dangerous virus has spooked global markets and threatened prospects for economic growth.
articles.abstract: The spread of the dangerous virus has spooked global markets and threatened prospects for economic growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Before a mysterious respiratory illness emerged in the center of China, spreading with lethal effect through the world’s most populous nation, concerns about the health of the global economy had been easing, replaced by a measure of optimism.

articles.headline: Bolton Revelations Anger Republicans, Fueling Push for Impeachment Witnesses
articles.snippet: The former national security adviser’s account threatened to derail Republican hopes of bringing President Trump’s impeachment trial to a quick close with his acquittal.
articles.abstract: The former national security adviser’s account threatened to derail Republican hopes of bringing President Trump’s impeachment trial to a quick close with his acquittal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House and Senate Republican leaders struggled on Monday to salvage their plans for a quick acquittal of President Trump after a new account by his former national security adviser John R. Bolton corroborated a central piece of the impeachment case against him.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Flying Into Patchy Fog, Kobe Bryant’s Pilot Had a Decision to Make
articles.snippet: The weather was good when the helicopter with nine passengers left Orange County. But as they flew north, it quickly grew worse.
articles.abstract: The weather was good when the helicopter with nine passengers left Orange County. But as they flew north, it quickly grew worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: CALABASAS, Calif. — The helicopter carrying the basketball legend Kobe Bryant on Sunday morning circled over a golf course in Los Angeles’s Griffith Park, awaiting clearance from air traffic controllers to continue its flight into the hills.
articles.byline: By Dave Philipps, Tim Arango and Louis Keene

articles.headline: A Divided Hong Kong Confronts the Arrival of the Coronavirus
articles.snippet: Hong Kong announced the shutdown of major rail passenger links and limits on flights coming from the mainland. China will stop issuing visas for individual travelers to the territory.
articles.abstract: Hong Kong announced the shutdown of major rail passenger links and limits on flights coming from the mainland. China will stop issuing visas for individual travelers to the territory.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The two Hong Kong protesters were dressed head to toe in black, their faces covered in masks. They smashed their Molotov cocktails into the lobby of a public housing estate, and flames and smoke began spewing out.

articles.headline: How People of Color Inside the Buttigieg Campaign Sought to Be Heard
articles.snippet: As the candidate courted nonwhite voters, employees of color were voicing their frustrations, according to interviews, documents and a recording. The campaign said it worked to foster a progressive workplace.
articles.abstract: As the candidate courted nonwhite voters, employees of color were voicing their frustrations, according to interviews, documents and a recording. The campaign said it worked to foster a progressive workplace.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early December, more than 100 members of Pete Buttigieg’s presidential campaign staff gathered at the South Bend City Church a mile from headquarters for a mandatory half-day retreat about diversity and inclusion. Less than two months remained before the start of voting, a time when most campaigns are focused full-time on politics.

articles.headline: Britain Defies Trump Plea to Ban Huawei From 5G Network
articles.snippet: The move shows how an American effort against the Chinese wireless equipment company has stumbled.
articles.abstract: The move shows how an American effort against the Chinese wireless equipment company has stumbled.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain said on Tuesday that it would not ban equipment made by the Chinese technology giant Huawei from being used in its new high-speed 5G wireless network, the starkest sign yet that an American campaign against the telecommunications company is faltering.

articles.headline: Coronavirus Crisis Exposes Cracks in China’s Facade of Unity
articles.snippet: With anger rising over the response to the coronavirus outbreak, even some with ties to China’s leaders have called for acknowledging divisions, not papering them over.
articles.abstract: With anger rising over the response to the coronavirus outbreak, even some with ties to China’s leaders have called for acknowledging divisions, not papering them over.
articles.lead_paragraph: From the outside, China’s Communist Party appears powerful and effective. It has tightened its control over Chinese politics and culture, the economy and everyday life, projecting the image of a gradually unifying society.
